quest.name: One Fell Swoop
journal: Ryne appears to have recovered from her battle of wills with Eden.

Although Ryne was pushed to her limits as she struggled to seize control of Eden, it seems that she eventually succeeded. However, as she struggles to assert control over the mysterious entity, a warning sounds, and Ryne becomes acutely aware that Eden is being attacked from both within and without by unknown invaders. Thancred and Urianger race to repel the assailants that are approaching from the inner reaches, while you make your way to the exterior to confront an airborne foe as it swoops down from above.

※Eden's Gate: Descent can be accessed via the Duty Finder.

Though you are hard-pressed by a relentless aerial assault, you eventually succeed in clipping the enemy's wings. With victory secured, you prepare to join your comrades to find out whether Urianger and Thancred were able to put down the intruders.

Though you had assumed your vanquished foe to be unconscious, she struggles to her feet and threatens to finish what she had started. Before you, Thancred, and Urianger are drawn into another confrontation, Ryne steps forward to intervene, for reasons that perhaps she herself does not fully understand. After a brief and puzzling exchange of words, the girl collapses, leaving the rest of you to wonder what her true intentions might be. Thancred suggests taking her to the camp, in the hope that she may shed some light on the mysteries surrounding Eden once she has recovered.

Now that the danger has been averted, Ryne is able to turn her attention to strengthening her link with the core. She explains that not only is Eden more receptive to her commands, she has also made something of a discovery.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: The beast's fury hath subsided...

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Well, I'm glad that's over. But for how long?

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: It worked... I'm in control now. I think...

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: Although I'm now linked to Eden, I still need to figure out how to give it commands.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Pray tell, what caused it to convulse so violently?

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: It must have been when Eden rose into the air. I'm still struggling to stop it from drifting too far from the camp.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Even now, thou art─

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Ryne! What's going on!?

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: Ah... Above us! Something's coming this way! An enemy!

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: But how dost thou─ Ah! Could it be a sin eater!?

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: I...can't see them clearly, but... No, that's impossible!

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: What is it?

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: They're inside, too! Lots of them, trying to reach the core!

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Uninvited guests, eh? If I'd known they were coming, I would've tidied the place up.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Japes are a poor substitute for a viable stratagem.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: In that case, I suggest that you and I deal with the ones who're already inside.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: And Forename can welcome our airborne adversary.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Ryne, find out if Eden has any defenses we can make use of. Preferably ones that don't recognize us as the enemy.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: I'm not sure about that, but I can use the aether currents to send you wherever you need to go.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: That's my girl. All right, everyone, we've got work to do.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: From what I can tell, Eden is able to form simple structures by redirecting aether, so I'll try to give you something to stand on. When you're ready, head for that portal over there.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: Come on, Eden! Show me what you can do!

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: Forename! Thank goodness you're unharmed.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: We came as soon as we took care of our unwanted guests. They were a stubborn bunch and quite unlike anything I've ever seen in the First.

dialogue.name: VOIDWALKER
dialogue.text: (-???-)No... I won't let you...

dialogue.name: VOIDWALKER
dialogue.text: (-???-)Damn the Light... Damn you all!

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: Who are you? What do you want?

dialogue.name: VOIDWALKER
dialogue.text: (-???-)Why am I here!? What is happening...?

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: She's alive, but there's something strange about her aether...

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: She didn't seem too pleased with Ryne taking control of Eden, which may be what caused her to appear out of the blue. Beyond that, it's anyone's guess.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: 'Tis plain she is not a sin eater. Not even in part as Vauthry was.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Yet this knowledge does little to assuage my fears, for she is nonetheless possessed of a power most terrible.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: On the other hand, if she's feeling cooperative, she might be able to tell us more about Eden.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: I'll keep an eye on her until she wakes up. There's no telling what will happen when she does, but I'll make it clear that we mean her no harm. Well, no further harm, at the very least.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Obviously, it's not a good idea to bring her inside Eden. It's likely that reaching the core was her aim from the outset, so I'll take her to the camp.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: Now that things have settled down, I should get back inside and try strengthening my link to Eden.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: The girl is in the tent, fast asleep. Or possibly in a coma. One or the other. Either way, we have little choice but to wait for her to wake up.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: I have yet to discover the means by which the exterior was breached, though 'twould appear that the fiends that Thancred and I slew were of a similar nature to those led by thine own adversary. Voidsent, in other words.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: Although I had my hands full trying to control Eden, I caught a glimpse of your battle. That power... I've never seen anything like it.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: What thou witnessed was the tearing of the very fabric of reality─the creation of a rift through which voidsent may enter. But pray tell, Ryne, didst thou make any other observations?

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: Hmm... I couldn't sense any Light at all in that girl or her servants.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: And I can't really explain how, but she reminded me of Emet-Selch.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Though I think it unlikely that she is an Ascian, she may yet be thrall to Zodiark.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: Maybe we'll be able to find out more once she's woken up. In the meantime, I'll try to improve my control over Eden.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: It seems to be listening more than before, instead of screaming at me like it was in the beginning. And that's not all! I've made an exciting discovery!
